title: Transport Authority Act 2008 (No. 15 of 2008) to the making of these Bye-laws,
heading: 1. (1) These Bye-laws may be cited as the National Transport Authority
text_raw:
1. (1) These Bye-laws may be cited as the National Transport Authority 

(Public Passenger Transport Services) (Amendment) Bye-laws 2025. 

(2) The Principal Bye-laws and these bye-laws may be cited together as the 
National Transport Authority (Public Passenger Transport Services) Bye-laws 
2019 and 2025. 

(3) These Bye-laws shall come into operation on [ • ] 2025.

title: Transport Authority Act 2008 (No. 15 of 2008) to the making of these Bye-laws,
heading: 3. (1) Bye-law 2 of the Principal Bye-laws is amended in subparagraph (1)
text_raw:
3. (1) Bye-law 2 of the Principal Bye-laws is amended in subparagraph (1) 

by inserting the following after the definition of “Leap Card”: 

““omnibus” has the same meaning as it has in Section 3 of the Road Traffic Act 
1961 (No. 24 of 1961);”. 

(2) Bye-law 7 of the Principal Bye-laws is amended by substituting the 

following: 

“7. 
A person (with the exception of a responsible person) shall not board or 
alight from, or attempt to board or alight from a vehicle while it is in motion or, 

(a) 

(b) 

in the case of an omnibus on a route or portion of a route on 
which there are stands or stopping places, between bus stops; or 

in the case of any vehicle other than an omnibus on a route or 
portion of a route on which there are stands or stopping places, 
between places identified by the driver as a departure point or 
destination point for that person’s trip.”. 

(3) Bye-law 31 of the Principal Bye-laws is amended by substituting the 

following for paragraph (1): 

“(1) A person shall not by signal or other indication cause the driver of a 
vehicle to stop the vehicle except for the purpose of enabling that person to 
board, or to alight from, the vehicle, 

(a) 

in the case of an omnibus on a route or portion of a route on 
which there are stands or stopping places, at a bus stop; or

EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Bye-laws apply to bus services provided by certain bus operators on 
behalf of the National Transport Authority and specify the rules for the boarding 
and alighting from a large public service vehicle while it is in motion and the 
rules for signalling or other indications causing the driver of a large public 
service vehicle to stop the large public service vehicle for the purpose of enabling 
a person board, or to alight from, the large public service vehicle that apply to 
omnibus’ on a route or portion of a route on which there are stands or stopping 
places and the rules for all other large public service vehicles.
